ygData.subject: Re: Bard% was (Patch message)
ygData.msgSnippet: That s OK Rokenn, so am I.  I used this song a lot before I had a DE Illusion and still do when DE illusion will get me killed.  (FV anyone?)  Have also used
ygData.messageBody:
That's OK Rokenn, so am I. I used this song a lot before I had a DE
Illusion and still do when DE illusion will get me killed. (FV
anyone?) Have also used it to see invis the party without killing
pets. Easier to mem a song and play it than wait for a caster to mem
and buff everyone.

~Beatdrop Battledrum
51st Minstrel of the Karana Server
And Rokenn's crappy bard buddy


--- In eqbards@y..., "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@p...> wrote:
> Yup, I guess I am the crappiest bard that ever lived.
>
> ------------------------------------
> Ro-kenn Swiftsong - Ayonae Ro server
> 55th level Wood Elf Troubador
>
> EQ Bard Song Analysis
> http://eqsongs.com/
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Adam Wasserman [mailto:wassermana@k...]
> Sent: Tuesday, February 27, 2001 10:14 AM
> To: 'eqbards@y...'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Bard% was (Patch message)
>
>
> ANY bard that is wasting a song slot to sing this should be booted.
Get a
> cold stone, get a DE mask (I know level 3 bards with this), get a
glowing
> stone band, get a caster to cast ultra vision on you. WHATEVER.
This song is
> useless, and to try to justify it by saying that there are a few
select uses
> for it is being argumentative.
>
> This song rates up there with Denon's Desperate Dirge, Melody of
Ervaj and
> Solon's Charismatic Concord.
>
> Draelon Stormsong
> Troubador of Karana
> Tribunal Server
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jeffrey Sue [mailto:jsue@r...]
> Sent: Tuesday, February 27, 2001 1:20 PM
> To: eqbards@y...
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Bard% was (Patch message)
>
>
> At 12:59 PM 2/27/01 -0500, you wrote:
> >i have never used concord once. never. it is useless.
>
> that would have been a correct statement if you had added ''to me''
at the
> end of ''it is useless''. if you were a human bard without a dark
elf mask,
> i believe you would find it very useful.
>
